passage_text: A knot is a unit of velocity typically used for boats and aircraft. Miles per hour, on the other hand, measures the speed of cars in the United States. One knot equals a speed of 1 nautical mile per hour, or 6,076 feet per hour. One mile per hour equals 5,280

A knot, or nautical mile (6076 feet), is about 15% longer than a statute mile (5280). So, if you're traveling at a speed of 20 knots in a motor boat, you simply multiply 20 X … 1.15 to get 23 mph. To go from mph to knots, multiply mph by about .87 to get knots.

Knots is how the speed of aircraft and boats is measured. Both miles per hour and knots is a speed which is the number of units of distance that is covered for a certain amount of time. 1 knot = 1 nautical mile per hour = 6076 feet per hour. 1 mph =1 mile per hour = 5280

A knot, therefore, is not a nautical mile, it is a nautical mile per hour. Thus 1 knot was equivalent to 1 nautical mile per hour; 5 knots were equivalent to 5 nautical miles per hour; etc. The similar sound of knot and naut is entirely coincidental.
